reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2024

reviewDescription: I am an experienced needleworker who purchased this kit for my 9-year-old granddaughter. She enjoys crafts and I wanted to introduce her to an easy form of needlework. The kit has cute and easily- manageable designs and is decent quality for a beginner's set. It includes cotton floss, needles, needle threaders, nice hoops, key chains and fabric that is stamped with the various designs. The fabric is very stiff and difficult to evenly place in the hoops. The accompanying instructions are very good at describing how to do cross stitch. However, the instructions do not include how to attach the provided keychains to convert the finished cross-stitch hoops to the advertised backpack charms nor how to trim the excess fabric. These last 2 steps are not easy to do and children will definitely need help with them. Personally, I would find other ways to display the completed hoops since they won't last very long as backpack charms. That is exactly what we did - we hung a completed one on my granddaughter's desk and it looks really cute. This is a nice kit for a beginning cross stitch project, but I wouldn't count on it as a backpack charm.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2025

reviewDescription: Bought this for my greatgranddaughter for her birthday. We will have a Cross Stitch Day and this looks like the perfect way for her to learn. Plus the pattern is printed in color to show her where to begin and how to proceed. These small projects will teach basics....then we will gradually introduce more challenging projects. I am very impressed by the quality and the price. I have shared my love of cross stitch with my five granddaughters and I hope to pass on my love of counted cross stitch to my greatgranddaughter.

reviewDescription: Tl;dr great kits, check them carefully to make sure all the parts are included and are undamaged. I teach a beginner cross stitch class to 8 year olds and these kits are great. The kids loved the cute designs. I separated the embroidery thread needed for each design ahead of time, which takes forever but it allowed the students to just sew. The preprinted designs make it so easy for them to see which colors go where. However, the first kit that was sent to me was missing a screw for the hoop (it doesn‚Äôt work without it). The replacement set had one of the fabrics sliced across the design. The third one was intact. And although there are enough designs for 5 kids to sew, every single kit only came with 4 needles. Luckily I had an extra. This is only a problem if you‚Äôre using it for 5 kids like I did.

reviewDescription: I‚Äôm cross stitching a Christmas stocking for our new baby. My 6 year old daughter wants to do what I do.
